item.title: Learning 3d
item.description: I have started learning 3D, it’s something that I think is pretty neat, and there is a wide range of creative opportunities within it. The software that I chose to use in my learning journey is Blender. Blender is open-source, free, and has a fantastic community behind it! It’s really easy to find tutorials and resources for it, and a lot of studios use it daily. I read a lot of interviews with professionals in the field, and almost all of them say that the most important thing is to learn the theory behind 3D modeling.

item.title: T-Virus
item.description: A Resident Evil T-Virus done as a practice for modeling, shading and lighting. The final render was done entirely in Blender, with post-production in Photoshop.

item.title: Lipstick
item.description: A 3D exercise that I did using the amazing work of Melih Ucer as reference. I was training how to illuminate a scene without HDR and still get a good product photoshoot feel.
